author: Novelty
title: The Deep
review:
Despite all appearance, this is a minifig pack with an aquanaut and a aquashark.  Of course, the set is packed with a shark and an octopus for play and a number of the seaweed plants for the backdrop.

There is nothing special about either minifig, each is the usual minifig found in their respective larger sets.  The aquanaut is equipped with silver daggers while the aquashark has silver harpoons.  There's also a silver crystal for the 2 of them to fight over.

This set has some display and play potential, but there isn't any building involved.

author: hustla187
title: Good Use of Accessories
review: If you are a huge Aquazone fan, this is one you should pick up. You get 2 minifigs, shark, octopus, and some sea bushes.It may seem like nothing at all but it isn't that bad. This is a good set to add on to your collection or to make a ocean creation if you wish.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Aquazone - Aquacessories
review:
The Aquacessories (6104) is a LEGO Aquazone set which came out in 1996. It comes with 2 minifigs and 23 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no missing pieces in this set.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/6104-1.jpg[/img]


Aquacessories:

The aquacessories comes with 2 minifigs, a black octopus, a dark gray shark, 3 plants and 2 silver chrystals. This set is a cool accessory to your Aquazone, Aqua Raiders or to your Atlantis collection. There're no play features in this set but the only reasons why you should pick this set up is because of the 2 crystals, the minifigs, the plants which you can add to your underwater scene and because of the creatures. 2 plants are stacked up.

The minifigs are relly cool. We get a black diver with a black helmet, a red visor, a transparent yellow hook for a hand, black pants, black fins and a yellow belt. On his torso you can see some cool markings. On the back of the helmet are 2 handles where you can put on the knife and the harpoon piece. On the face you can see brown hair and a headset.

The other diver has blue pants, blue fins, a white belt, a white helmet, a transparent blue visor, white hands and black arms. Also this helmet has a handle on each side where you can put the weapons for the diver minifig. His torso is printed white and blue and we get some cool markings on it too. On his face you can find a red headband and a beard.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Minifigs
Nice starter set
No stickers
Nice addition to your LEGO Aquazone, Aqua Raiders and Atlantis collection

Negative:

No play features



All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: BobaFett2
title: This set has ups and downs-but it evens out in the end
review:
I got this set nearly complete from part of a friend's LEGO collection. I completed it myself with instructions from peeron.com.

Instructions/Presentation

So how is this set presented? It shows an Aquanaut and an Aquashark on a cool blue terrain piece. There's two bushes, a crystal just sitting there (I assume the Aquashark is swimming towards it), and two sea animals-an octopus and a shark, swimming around. The set is an accessories pack, but that didn't stop LEGO from making it look good.

Design

There's not much to say about design-this is a part pack. I like to think of it as the "ancient" version of a battle pack-a few Minifigures, 2 sea creatures, and a few common accessories from the theme. If the animal are counted as Minifigures, that's a pretty nice battle pack.

Minifigures

The set includes two Minifigures: an Aquashark and an Aquanaut. The aquanaut is standard, with a sweatband, armor, flippers, and thankfully trans light blue visor (less common than black). The Aquashark has a trans neon green hook hand-awesome. Sharks and Octopi are some of the coolest sea animals, and some of the most useful.

Price

For 6 dollars, I'm getting 22 parts. This includes Minifigures and animals. Not the best, I know, but things were different back then. I AM getting lots of knives and harpoons (I just LOVE those knives), plus some animals, bushes, and Minifigures. I'd say it's worth it for the diehard (or not so hard) Aquazone fan.

Playability

Well this is obviously not swooshable. It is, however, extremely useful for setting up a little vignette-all you need are a few rocks and maybe some transparent bricks (for a swimming effect), and it's good. Or you can improve the bases (the Aquasharks have no base, the Aquanauts have an awesome one) with an extra fig and bush. Plus you get more of those crystals that they were warring over.

Overall

Pros:
  • Minifigures
  • Chrome Accessories
  • Animals
  • Bushes
Cons:
  • Expensive
  • Not enough parts?
Do I recommend this set? If you can get one for a decent price on bricklink, go ahead. It's great.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Aquazone Battle Pack
review:
Set #6104 Aquacessories: An appropriate name for this little set. Aquacessories is exactly what this set was all about.

 

It includes two Mini-Figures, an Aquanaut and an Aquashark, it also includes a LEGO Octopus, a LEGO Shark, a few plants and an energy crystal. As well as the weapons that were first introduced with Aquazone. Chromed Silver Torpedoes and Daggers.

 

As far as Mini-Figure collections are concerned this one wasn't as impressive as some of the others. After all it only included two Mini-Figures instead of four or six, but it did give you a chance to get some LEGO animals to pit against your Aquanauts or Aquasharks, and it did have some nifty looking plants. (I wish LEGO would re-introduce that red color for those pieces in the new under water themes.)

 

I'd recommend this set to any Aquazone fans. It might not look like much, but it has a lot of useful additions for the other Aquazone sets. Plus you can never have enough energy crystals and this one has two.
